posts.title: Taste and See
posts.content:
As one of the few bar and spirit tasting rooms in Northwest Arkansas, Lakepoint bar makes an experience out of finding the right drink.

  • Cocktail hour: Located on Loch Lomond in Bella Vista, The Tasting Room at Lakepoint is ideal for for an afternoon with a friend or a group of friends. Their wine and spirit collection is tough to surpass.
  • Bartender special: Each weekend, the team at Lakepoint picks a different theme of several wines and spirits, creating an experience out of learning about producers, regions, and varietals.

Discover the Tasting Room and all that Lakepoint has to offer HERE.

posts.title: Weekend Roundup
posts.content:
We have good news and bad news.. Good news: it's the weekend and there is a lot happening! Bad news: a lot of events have been cancelled. However, as of now here is what we know is occurring:

  • Glowing fun: Take part tonight in transforming the art trail into a glow trail at CBMAA.
  • Craving tunes: Looking for the right live music this weekend, find all the shows in the area here.
  • BFF: Bentonville Film Festival continues through this weekend with multiple showings in person and virtual.
  • Grape Festival: Tontitown's annual Grape Festival is happening today and tomorrow.
  • Paint off: Saturday, there is some messy family-friendly fun with a paint party happening at CBMAA.
  • Celebrate the small town: Elkfest 2021 is happening this weekend out in Elkins.
  • Lady A: Lady A is performing on Saturday at the Walmart AMP in Rogers.
  • NWA Comic Con: Happening this Saturday and Sunday in Rogers.
  • WOZ: Women of OZ have their monthly flagship ride in Bentonville on Saturday.

Have a great weekend and see you Monday!

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• More than a pet: Pipes for Pups held its largest fundraiser last weekend, helping service dogs find homes.
  • New neighbors: Millions of dollars have been exchanging hands in property acquisitions.
  • Time for a check-up: NW Health helps keep you safe with advice for a healthy school year.
  • Mask up: Fayetteville Public Schools will require masks for this school year.
  • Friendly competition: OU and the U of A will play a "multi-year, neutral-site basketball series" starting this winter.
  • Collaboration talk: We want to feature your local business - check out our advertising packages.
